Technical Assistance Report 
Project Number: 49028  
Project Preparatory Technical Assistance (PPTA) 
November 2015 
 
 
 
People’s Republic of China: Hebei Elderly Care 
Development Project 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
This  document  is  being  disclosed  to  the  public  in  accordance  with  ADB's  Public 
Communications Policy 2011.  
The views expressed herein are those of the consultant and do not necessarily represent those of ADB’s 
members, Board of Directors, Management, or staff, and may be preliminary in nature.

PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
A.  Justification 
1.  The project preparatory technical assistance (PPTA) is required to prepare an investment 
project for possible funding by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to support the development of 
elderly care (EC) services in Hebei Province, the People's Republic of China (PRC). Project 
components are likely to include capacity building and piloting innovative approaches, upgrading 
and renovation of EC facilities, and procurement of equipment.  
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
2.   The PPTA will carry out a detailed situation and gap analysis on elderly care systems 
(ECSs) and services in the proposed subproject areas and at the provincial level. Based on the 
analysis and the participatory process described below, the PPTA will develop an appropriate 
project design, including rationale; description of outputs; financing and investment plan; detailed 
costing, procurement plan, consultant selection, and implementation arrangements; safeguards 
due diligence and mitigation measures; risk and mitigation measures; legal assurances required; 
and a design and monitoring framework. Technical reports will be produced in line with the terms of 
reference of the PPTA consultants. The PPTA will develop a project administration manual, an 
operational manual detailing each project activity, a development coordination matrix, a financial 
and economic analysis, a financial management and procurement capacity assessment of the 
executing agency and implementing agencies, detailed project costing, a gender analysis and plan, 
an  environmental  impact  assessment  and  environmental  management  plan  as  required, 
conceptual designs of the EC facilities, a poverty and social analysis, a summary poverty reduction 
and social strategy, and a risk assessment and management plan. The PPTA will identify smart 
design of procurement arrangements to ensure streamlined implementation. 
 
3.  Using a participatory consultative approach, the PPTA consultants will work closely with, 
and report to, designated focal points of the executing and implementing agencies, and the project 
leading group. Civil society, private sector, and other development partners involved in the EC 
sector  will  be  consulted  during  PPTA  processing  and  implementation.  A  set  of  stakeholder 
workshops will be organized (i) at the beginning of PPTA implementation to gather initial inputs for 
the work to be carried out under the PPTA, and (ii) towards the midterm of PPTA implementation to 
report on the work accomplished and agree on an initial project design and monitoring framework. 
Surveys  will  be  organized  as  required  and  agreed  with  the  executing  agency.  Focus  group 
discussions and key informant interviews will be organized including elderly, service providers, civil 
society organizations, and governmental and private sector stakeholders.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement  
5.  The PPTA is estimated to cost $800,000 equivalent, which will be financed on a grant basis 
by ADB's Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-other sources). The government will provide 
counterpart  support  in  the  form  of  counterpart  staff,  office  accommodation,  office  supplies, 
secretarial  and  translation  assistance,  domestic  transportation,  communication  facilities  for 
consultants, and other in-kind contributions.

D.  Consulting Services 
6.  The  consulting services will be engaged by the ADB in accordance with ADB’s Guidelines 
on the Use of Consultants (2013, as amended from time to time) to ensure immediate mobilization 
and facilitate project scoping. The PPTA will be conducted using individual consultants and an 
international firm. ADB will select and engage an international firm based on the quality of the 
proposal (80%) and the cost (20%) of the services to be provided (the quality- and cost-based 
selection method) using the simplified technical proposal procedure. A total of 62 person-months of 
consulting services (22 international and 40 national) are required.

7.  Senior project development specialist / team leader (international, 5 person-months). 
A postgraduate degree in economics or social sciences and experience in ADB project preparation 
are preferred. S/he will lead the team of consultants, submit all required PPTA outputs of the team 
of consultants, and design an appropriate project in line with ADB requirements. The team leader 
will consider efficient project design including streamlined procurement packages. 
 
8.  Senior  elderly  care  and  institutional  specialist  (international,  3  person-months; 
national,  5  person-months).  A  postgraduate degree  in  economics  or  business is preferred, with 
minimum of 10 years general experience working with government and private sector, and 5 years 
experience in ECS development. Deliverables are EC sector assessment in Hebei Province and 
institutional aspects of each subproject, and identified hubs for services and institutional care for 
urban/rural elderly. 
 
9.  Elderly care community and home-based specialist (international, 2 person-months; 
national  4  person-months).  A postgraduate degree in social sciences or nursing with basic 
experience in public health economics or business, minimum of 10 years general experience 
working with government and private sector, and 5 years experience in  ECS development is 
preferred. Concerned local governments of Hebei Province will be supported in enhancing the 
community and home-based care aspects of each subproject submitted for ADB financing. 
 
10.  Elderly care human resources development and training specialist (international, 2 
person-months;  national,  4  person-months).  A  Master’s  degree  in  education,  training 
management,  or  relevant  disciplines  and  experience  in  the  EC  sector;  minimum  of  15  years 
experience  (international)  in  the  development  of  human  resources  training  systems  and  EC 
curriculum development; and minimum of 10 years experience (national) in human resources and 
institutional development. Deliverables are assessment of human resources capacity development 
needs and subcomponent design to support improved quality and coverage of care services. 
 
11.  Public-private partnership advisor (national, 3 person-months). A Master’s degree in 
finance, economics, law, engineering, management, or other relevant field; minimum of 10 years 
experience in preparation of infrastructure or other public health services. Participation in private 
sector health service delivery is strongly preferred. Possesses detailed understanding of the fiscal 
and economic growth issues facing cities in the PRC and of the enabling environment for public-
private partnerships (PPP) and their use in the PRC. The consultant will identify and design at least 
two preliminary implementation plans for PPP for the institutional care subprojects in accordance 
with government requirements and good international practices.

13.  Elderly care design and development specialist /deputy team leader (international, 2 
person-months; national 6 person-months). A graduate degree in architecture or related fields; 
minimum  of  15  years  (international)  and  8  years  (national)  work  experience  in  public  facility 
programming, design, and development; and with strong expertise in EC and health care facilities. 
Deliverables  are  (i)  a  technical  review  of  the  EC  institution  design,  (ii)  recommendation  of 
alternative design features, and (iii) identified opportunities to improve universal design features in 
home-based and community service components. 
 
14.  Financial specialist (international, 3 person-months; national, 4 person-months). A 
Master’s degree or equivalent in accounting, economics, finance and/or business; and minimum of 
10 years experience. Deliverables include conducting financial due diligence of the proposed 
project loan in accordance with ADB’s requirements. 
 
15.  Economist (international, 1 person-month; national, 2 person-months). A Master’s 
degree or equivalent in accounting, economics, finance and/or business; and minimum of 10 years 
experience. S/he should have professional expertise in economic analysis and market analysis of a 
project. S/he will conduct the economic analysis for each project component and for the overall 
project in accordance with ADB’s Guidelines for Economic Analysis of Projects. 
 
16.  Involuntary resettlement specialist (national, 3 person-months). A Master’s degree in 
sociology or other relevant area, and minimum of 5 years of experience. The consultant will guide 
the Hebei Provincial Government in the involuntary resettlement safeguard due diligence, and 
prepare  and  make  arrangements  for  resettlement  plan(s)  implementation  and  monitoring,  if 
necessary. 
 
17.  Poverty, social, and gender specialist (international, 2 person-months; national, 4 
person-months). A Master’s degree in anthropology, sociology, gender, development, or other 
relevant area; and minimum of 10 years (for international) and 5 years (for national) experience. 
Deliverables are poverty and social analysis, design, and survey and qualitative fieldwork, and 
inputs in other assessments (poverty and social assessment, social plan, gender action plan, and 
summary poverty reduction and social strategy). 
 
18.  Environment specialist (international, 2 person-months; national, 3 person-months).       
Minimum of 10 years (international) and 8 years (national) experience. Deliverables are initial 
environmental assessment of the project EC facilities, inputs to the other consultant assessments, 
and all necessary documentation.
